content: Welcome to the Diagnostic Request, Report and Observation track. We will use this topic for our group (online) communications today.

link to the Clinicians on FHIR page
http://wiki.hl7.org/index.php?title=Clinician_on_FHIR_-_January_2017,_San_Antonio

Diagnostic Test
Added patient with the id : 18209
http://ltd.aruplab.com/Tests/Pub/0090307 Let's use this TCA (Qual) test

BMP order w specimen collection info: 0020399
http://ltd.aruplab.com/Tests/Pub/0020399

In case anyone's interested, here's a Patient/Specimen/DiagnosticRequest example recently assembled by one of my colleagues:
https://github.com/nmdp-bioinformatics/dash/tree/master/fhir/fhir_hla_examples
For the DiagnosticRequest, he used LOINC code 13303-3, for HLA-A+​B+​C (class I) [Type]. Apparently, there wasn't a code to fully cover our typical genetic typing activity which, in addition to genes HLA-A, HLA-B, and HLA-C, includes genes HLA-DRB1, HLA-DRB3/4/5, HLA-DQB1, and HLA-DPB1 (and may also include the CCR5 gene and genetic blood group predictions for ABO and Rh).
@David Hay A suggest improvement is to display the Patient Name in the Scenario Builder Header/Banner.
@Peter Jordan - thanks, will do.
A Refresh Scenario button would also be useful - if use cases for team-built scenarios extend beyond connectathons?
yes - you could imagine that there is a model in the library that gets synced to multiple clients. A few details to think through there :)
